title: Jack Hughes drops Connor McDavid 'greatest player ever' praise after Olympics win
description: The newly-minted American legend still had to acknowledge greatness.
fullText:
Jack Hughes drops Connor McDavid 'greatest player ever' praise after Olympics win originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

With the Olympics gold medal match loss, Connor McDavid has yet again fallen short of winning the ultimate prize at a tournament. Fans started buzzing about how the Edmonton Oilers legend was 'always the bridesmaid, never the bride'. While these chirps may have come at the height of the Americans winning the gold medal after 46 years, Team USA and New Jersey Devils' Jack Hughes knew that McDavid was still the best player out there.

Hughes ended up scoring the gold medal-winning goal against Team Canada. He will always remain as a legend in all of America and with the Devils. But, he was tasked with a really tough task of guarding McDavid all night. Prior to his insane goal, he had to shut the Oilers legend one last time too.

He got real on how difficult the task was because of the Canadian star's prowess on the ice, via Dan Rosen of NHL.com.

"When the best player in the world, maybe ever, comes down on you in overtime in the gold medal game and you‚Äôre a forward, my first thought was ‚ÄòI¬† have got to gap up. Then I was like, ‚ÄòI can‚Äôt gap up, he‚Äôll just blow right by me.‚Äô So, I just sunk in and hopefully he can‚Äôt get around me because there‚Äôs not enough space in between me and the net. And that‚Äôs honestly kind of what happened," he declared.

Hughes' effort only came out of instinct because of what was at stake and who skated down towards him. McDavid was eventually named the Most Valuable Player for men's hockey at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics. This came after he ran the Canadian offense as much as he could up until the gold medal game. The Oilers legend scored two goals while also dishing out 11 assists in the tournament.

The bane of the best players in their field is the constant challenge of opposing players leveling up when coming across them. Hopefully, McDavid is able to dispel the 'always the bridesmaid, never the bride' narrative once he returns with the Oilers.

title: Prep talk: El Camino Real's December twins like baseball and music
description: Hudson and Chance December play piano and play baseball at El Camino Real.
fullText:
When you ask twins Hudson and Chance December about their unusual last name, it's like there's a secret to be kept.

In fact, the two junior baseball players at El Camino Real have a famous father who changed his last name to December. That's Nathan December, a rock guitarist who was a side musician with R.E.M. and the Goo Goo Dolls.

His love for music has been passed on to the twins. Both play piano and guitar. They're involved in El Camino Real's arts program.

As for baseball, they both played for El Camino Real's championship junior varsity team last season and are trying to find a spot on the 10-time City championship varsity team that won the title last season at Dodger Stadium.

If El Camino Real could only transport a piano to the baseball field, the December boys probably would deliver a cool national anthem.

This is a daily look at the positive happenings in high school sports. To submit any news, please email eric.sondheimer@latimes.com.

A. Times SoCal high school sports newsletter to get scores, stories and a behind-the-scenes look at what makes prep sports so popular.

This story originally appeared in Los Angeles Times.

title: German public broadcasters with record figures for Winter Olympics
description: German public-service broadcasters ARD and ZDF registered record numbers of viewers during the Milan/Cortina Winter Olympics, which closed on Sunday. According to the broadcasters, never before have so many people followed the TV coverage of the Winter Games in the country.
fullText:
German public-service broadcasters ARD and ZDF registered record numbers of viewers during the Milan/Cortina Winter Olympics, which closed on Sunday.

According to the broadcasters, never before have so many people followed the TV coverage of the Winter Games in the country.

An average of 3.173 million people watched the live broadcasts on the two free-to-air TV channels, representing a market share of 23.2%.

The reach is almost twice as high as in the previous Games in Beijing in 2022 (1.67 million), which, however, took place in a different time zone.

But all the relevant figures are also significantly higher than those for Turin, where the last Winter Games in Germany's time zone took place 20 years ago.

"In times like these, people are particularly receptive to the Olympics. People love emotional moments," ARD sports coordinator Axel Balkausky said.

The men's doubles in luge had the largest audience as 6.79 million people watched the event live. The biathlon, Germany's most popular winter sport, was shortly behind with 6.63 million fans tuning in to watch the mixed relay.

During the Olympics, millions of sports fans are also enthusiastic about disciplines that are usually hardly noticed.

"Every four years, people specifically search for curling," Balkausky said.

Particularly striking was the reach among young people: according to the broadcasters, some 35% of viewers were between 14 and 29 years old.

Parallel to the large number of viewers watching traditional television, there was also enormous reach on the internet with up to seven live streams.

ARD recorded more than 85 million video views, while ZDF had more than 50 million views by Saturday.

"The digital figures are going through the roof. We were successful in every way," Balkausky celebrated.

title: MW10 RSL Fantasy Scouting Session: Picks to consider to rack up points!
description: Mexican star Julian Quinones didn‚Äôt just shine on Matchweek 23 by claiming his unrivalled 10th Man of the Match award, he also led a midfield takeover in Roshn Saudi League Fantasy. Midfielders domi...
fullText:
Mexican star Julian Quinones didn‚Äôt just shine on Matchweek 23 by claiming his unrivalled 10th Man of the Match award, he also led a midfield takeover in Roshn Saudi League Fantasy. Midfielders dominated the scoring charts, occupying a remarkable seven of the top 10 spots.

With players in that position consistently delivering the highest Fantasy returns, choosing the right ones can make or break your line-up.

With that in mind, here‚Äôs our recommendations for the postponed Matchweek 10, laid out nicely in a first XI, all while sticking to a budget of SAR 80 million.

Not already playing? Well, what are you waiting for: sign up at¬†https://en.fantasy.spl.com.sa¬†now!

Edouard Mendy¬†-¬†Al Ahli (6.6 million)

The league‚Äôs top goalkeeper this season, with 9 clean sheets, the Al Ahli captain travels to Abha to face a Damac who‚Äôve dropped into the bottom three. Mendy currently sits on 98 Fantasy points and is expected to break the 100-mark in this round.

Muhannad Al Shanqiti¬†-¬†Al Ittihad (5.2m)

Despite playing fewer matches this season, Al Shanqiti is enjoying his most productive campaign yet. He has already scored¬†3 goals¬†- a personal best - and added¬†6 assists. He‚Äôll look to continue that form for the RSL champions at Al Hazem.

Mohamed Simakan¬†- Al Nassr FC¬†(5.7m)

A smart differential pick, Simakan is selected by only 18.9 percent of managers despite being among the top-five defenders in total points. He has kept¬†six consecutive clean sheets¬†and even scored during that run. Next up? An away match at bottom club Najmah.

Zakaria Hawsawi¬†-¬†Al Ahli (4.2m)

For the second straight season, Hawsawi is contributing both defensively and offensively. He recently assisted¬†Riyad Mahrez¬†at¬†Al Shabab and even scored against¬†Al Taawoun. Trusted by Al Ahli manager¬†Matthias Jaissle, Hawsawi has been part of six clean sheets in nine appearances.

Julian Quinones¬†-¬†Al Qadsiah (10.4m)

The game‚Äôs in-form star made his seventh Team of the Week appearance in Matchweek 23, scoring¬†25 points. Remarkably, he‚Äôs the only Fantasy player to hit 25+ points in three different rounds this season. Al Qadsiah host Eastern Derby rivals¬†Al Ettifaq.

Even in defeat to Al Ettifaq, Batna delivered¬†19 Fantasy points, second only to Quinones for the round. While¬†Khalid Al Ghannam¬†earned 13 points in the same match, Batna‚Äôs individual performance stood out. Al Fateh welcome second-from-bottom Al Okhdood.

Yannick Carrasco¬†-¬†Al Shabab (7.2m)

The brilliant Belgian has been instrumental in Al Shabab‚Äôs revival, scoring and assisting last time out in the win at Damac. The side goals-per-game average has climbed to¬†1.09, avoiding what could‚Äôve been their worst scoring season (2015-16 and 2016-17). They face¬†relegation battlers Al Riyadh.

The Algeria superstar has contributed to¬†four goals in his past two matches¬†and remains central to Al Ahli‚Äôs title bid. Since December 29, Al Ahli have collected¬†34 points, more than¬†Al Qadsiah (32),¬†Al Hilal (28), and¬†Al Nassr (25). Mahrez has been key.

Fashion Sakala¬†-¬†Al Fayha (8.0m)

Al Fayha‚Äôs man of the moment is in red-hot form, matching¬†Ivan Toney¬†for the best scoring streak over the past three rounds. Sakala has netted¬†eight goals in seven of his past eight outings yet is selected by fewer than 5% of managers - a high-risk, high-reward option. Al Fayha host¬†NEOM Sports Club¬†on Wednesday.

Alexandre Lacazette¬†-¬†NEOM SC¬†(6.8m)

The firing Frenchman earned nine points last time out after scoring the winner at Al Khaleej. Lacazette averages 8.5 points per game¬†over his past four matches and now takes that hot streak to Al Fayha in the postponed fixture.

Abderrazak Hamdallah¬†-¬†Al Shabab (9.0m)

After missing 11 rounds (16 matches total), the RSL‚Äôs all-time second-highest scorer is gradually returning to form. Hamdallah came off the bench against Al Ahli and then scored on Friday when starting at Damac.

With only 30 total points and a 10.4% selection rate, the mighty Moroccan could become a valuable differential if he regains his scoring rhythm. Especially with new manager Noureddine Ben Zekri in charge.

Midfielders continue to dominate RSL Fantasy scoring so, with several players in exceptional form and postponed fixtures creating unique opportunities, this round could reward bold-but-calculated selections.

Choose wisely - and don‚Äôt underestimate the power of an in-form middle man!

title: Rory McIlroy shares what impressed him about Jacob Bridgeman in Genesis Invitational final round
description: Jacob Bridgeman beat Rory McIlroy by one stroke to win the Genesis Invitational on Sunday. Despite having a six-shot lead before the final round, Bridgeman came under pressure from McIlroy and Kurt Kitayama.
fullText:
Jacob Bridgeman beat Rory McIlroy by one stroke to win the Genesis Invitational on Sunday.

Despite having a six-shot lead before the final round, Bridgeman came under pressure from McIlroy and Kurt Kitayama.

The 26-year-old did not perform as well as he did in the first three rounds, but it was still enough for the victory at Riviera.

After playing alongside Bridgeman in the final group, McIlroy explained how the first-time PGA Tour winner impressed him.

Bridgeman‚Äôs one-over-par 72 in the final round was just enough to finish ahead of McIlroy and Kitayama.

He looked nervous at times on the back nine, but he also played some high-quality shots and made several clutch putts.

McIlroy recognised the difficulty of winning your first PGA Tour event and was impressed by Bridgeman‚Äôs mentality.

He even suggested that Bridgeman‚Äôs score (+1) was not a true reflection of the solid golf he played throughout the day.

‚ÄúI thought he handled everything really well,‚Äù McIlroy reflected. ‚ÄúAs I said at the start, because I wasn‚Äôt putting pressure on him, it probably felt to him like he didn‚Äôt need to do that much, but he played very well.

‚ÄúI was surprised he was even par because I felt he was very much in control of his golf ball. He drove it great; he hit his irons well. But it‚Äôs hard, it‚Äôs hard to close out big tournaments.

‚ÄúEven though he was a little shaky coming down the stretch, he held it together when he needed to. He holed a clutch comeback putt on 13 for par.

‚ÄúHe played smart on 16 when he missed it in the bunker. That putt on the last isn‚Äôt easy. Leaves it a little bit short, and the crowd reacts, and you‚Äôve got to take your time a little bit.

‚ÄúI give him all the props; he did what he needed to do, and I‚Äôm happy for him.‚Äù

McIlroy will feel like he missed a golden opportunity to defeat Bridgeman and win the Genesis Invitational on Sunday.

The Northern Irishman was excellent from tee to green in the final round, but he did not make enough putts to catch his playing partner.

McIlroy lost 1.88 strokes to the field on the greens on Sunday, the second-worst putting performance of the top 20 players.

Had he converted one more of his many birdie chances, he would have faced Bridgeman in a playoff for the title.

Still, McIlroy can be delighted with his improved performance ahead of the Arnold Palmer Invitational and the Players Championship next month.

Jordan Spieth makes firm vow to avoid repeat on PGA Tour after controversy in 2025

Rory McIlroy‚Äôs bunker magic leaves Jordan Spieth stunned at the Genesis Invitational

‚ÄòIt‚Äôs a big deal‚Äô ‚Äì Jordan Spieth reveals the ‚Äòweapon‚Äô he‚Äôs finally got back after the Genesis Invitational

title: Boca Juniors open talks with Dybala‚Äôs entourage
description: With just a few months to go before the summer transfer window opens, Paulo Dybala‚Äôs future is still up in the air. The Argentine talent, whose contract with the Giallorossi expires next June, could...
fullText:
With just a few months to go before the summer transfer window opens, Paulo Dybala‚Äôs future is still up in the air.

The Argentine talent, whose contract with the Giallorossi expires next June, could join his friend and former teammate Leandro Paredes in Argentina.

According to Matteo Moretto, the former Juventus player is currently ‚Äúmore out than in‚Äù at the Trigoria club.

Roma are evaluating his contract and appear to be considering a lower-priced renewal, given Dybala‚Äôs current earnings (‚Ç¨8 million net, ‚Ç¨16 million gross).

Boca Juniors remains interested, and they‚Äôre in constant contact with La Joya‚Äôs entourage. The Albiceleste player‚Äôs intentions remain unclear.

Dybala is in his fourth season with Roma and will soon become a father: the player is currently struggling with a knee problem that has kept him from the Giallorossi‚Äôs recent fixtures.

In the coming days, it will be clear whether Dybala will actually be available for the big match on Sunday, March 1st, against Juventus. The match against the Bianconeri could be one of the number 21‚Äôs last high-profile matches in a Roma jersey.

title: Virgil van Dijk Reflects On ‚ÄúDifficult‚Äù Victory Over Nottingham Forest
description: Liverpool got an undeserved and much needed win at relegation-threatened Forest on Sunday.
fullText:
Liverpool were not the better side on Sunday afternoon when they headed off to face a Nottingham Forest side in the midst of crisis in a season that has rather seemed non-stop crisis for the West Bridgford that are currently on their fourth (and maybe not their last) manager of the 2025-26 campaign.

The Reds‚Äô relegation-threatened opponents (who are on their fourth manager of the season) had more shots, created more expected goals, and even managed to appear to have more well-drilled patterns of play‚Äîof passing, pressing, and buildup. In the end, though, Liverpool managed to end up with all three points.

In the end, of course, that‚Äôs the point of the game and what matters most. Especially if you‚Äôre a Liverpool side who themselves have been at seemed on the verge of crisis for most of the season and are in a tough fight to finish in the Champions League places. The question, as always, is what comes next.

‚ÄúWe want to play our best football and I think at times we are doing that,‚Äù captain Virgil van Dijk reflected after everything was said and done in Sunday‚Äôs 1-0 victory. ‚ÄúObviously we are still looking for improvements and we are not perfect, but we are human beings and want to do our best for the club.

‚ÄúWe want to perform at the absolute highest levels, and we need everyone to be at their best so that‚Äôs a process, but we keep going and now the focus is on the next one. It feels definitely nice to win here, it‚Äôs a difficult ground and it was a very poor first half from all of us with and without the ball.‚Äù

The silver lining is perhaps that for as bad as Liverpool were early, they did improve as the game went on, at least relative their early struggles. And of course in the end a win is a win is a win‚Äîwhich puts them level on points with fifth-place Manchester United, at least until they take on Everton today.

On paper, too, Liverpool have one of the easier schedules of the sides battling to finish in the Champions League places in a season where top five are all but guaranteed of that. And for that, they need more wins. And for that, they‚Äôll need to improve on Sunday‚Äôs performance, eventually victory or not.

title: Chelsea Gray does it again, matching the Unrivaled record for 3-pointers in a game as Rose secures a playoff spot
description: Another night at Unrivaled. Another Chelsea Gray record. Gray‚Äôs 10 3s helped Rose clinch a playoff berth.
fullText:
The Point Gawd Chelsea Gray is known for her dazzling passes and her ability to be almost unguardable when she gets on a hot streak.

On Sunday night, she delivered one of those kinds of performances, matching Marina Mabrey‚Äôs Unrivaled record for 3-pointers in a game with 10. The number is gaudy, but it was also necessary. Rose needed every one of those points as they squeaked out a 70-66 victory against Laces.

Gray ended the game with a whopping 38 points, along with seven rebounds and four assists.

From the opening quarter, Gray was explosive. She scored 17 points in the first and knocked down half of her 3s within the first seven minutes. Thanks to her play and her contributions to Rose‚Äôs 12-4 run, they were in front of Laces 23-16.

In the second, Laces responded with a 12-5 run to even the game. Gray countered with yet another 3 as both teams exchanged baskets. Brittney Sykes was the engine that kept the Laces running with her 20-point first-half performance. Gray hit a 3-pointer to end the half, which gave Rose a 3-point lead, 42-39.

At this point, what can't Chelsea Gray do?! ü§Ø pic.twitter.com/iZBB5qOOYY

‚Äî Unrivaled Basketball (@Unrivaledwbb) February 23, 2026

Laces had some offensive struggles in the third, shooting 6-for-18 from the field. Rose took advantage as Gray continued to pile on, allowing Rose to carry a somewhat comfortable six-point lead into the fourth, 59-53.

Laces and Rose exchanged baskets, but with Rose ahead, they were able to hang on and not only win the game but also punch their ticket into the postseason.

Gray, who also hit the game winner, was far and away the best player for Rose. However, Kahleah Copper had a respectable game, scoring 10 points to go along with three rebounds and three assists.

Laces were led by the trio of Jackie Young, Alyssa Thomas and Sykes. Young had 17 points, Thomas scored 12 points and grabbed nine rebounds, and Sykes scored 24. While the loss was a disappointing one for Laces, the good news is they are still the No. 2 seed in Unrivaled, and their odds of staying in a top slot, and earning a bye to the semifinals, are still very high and in their control.

Before Laces‚Äô loss, Phantom strengthened their claim to the No. 1 seed thanks to their 84-66 win over Hive. The win also earned Phantom a first-round bye, meaning their chase for the championship will begin in the semifinals in Brooklyn.

As usual, Phantom was led by its duo of Aliyah Boston and Kelsey Plum. Boston scored 25 points and grabbed eight rebounds, leading the team in both categories, while Plum had 23 points along with six assists. With these two on the floor, any three-player combo Phantom rolls out will be one of the best in Unrivaled.

Due to the absences of Azur√° Stevens and Natisha Hiedeman, developmental player Aziaha James got the call up, and she did all she could to try to help Hive win, leading the club with 22 points. During the game, Hive also lost Sonia Citron due to an injury scare, which put them down to only four players for all of the second half.

Zaza is doing her things out here ü´° pic.twitter.com/IeY6sK202j

‚Äî Unrivaled Basketball (@Unrivaledwbb) February 23, 2026

Even with this loss, Hive still has hope for the sixth and final playoff spot, but Vinyl is a half game in front of them for that position, and the Lunar Owls are right behind them, just a game back.

It‚Äôs looking like the playoff picture won‚Äôt get finalized until the very end of the regular season.

title: Barcelona ace aiming to return to Spain squad for World Cup after lengthy injury-enforced absence
description: Barcelona midfielder Gavi is entering the most important phase of his recovery and his eyes are already fixed on the next World Cup.According to SPORT, the 21-year-old is highly motivated to return in...
fullText:
Barcelona midfielder Gavi is entering the most important phase of his recovery and his eyes are already fixed on the next World Cup.

According to SPORT, the 21-year-old is highly motivated to return in time to fight for a place in Spain‚Äôs squad.

After months of frustration on the sidelines, the young midfielder is finally back training with the group, taking careful steps toward full fitness.

Gavi has been out of top-level competition for nearly five months following surgery on his right knee meniscus on September 23.

The procedure forced him into a long rehabilitation process, but now he is gradually reintegrating into team sessions.

His workload remains controlled, with both the medical department and coaching staff keeping a close watch on every movement.

Within Barcelona, it has been made very clear that there will be no shortcuts.

The club believes it would make little sense to rush his return after showing patience for months.

The priority is to help Gavi regain confidence, rhythm and match sharpness without risking setbacks.

Gavi wants to play the World Cup. (Photo by Florencia Tan Jun/Getty Images)

A knee injury is delicate, and Barcelona want him to feel completely secure before stepping back into competitive action.

As such, optimism is growing internally, as the upcoming international break could actually benefit him, giving him uninterrupted weeks of training without the pressure of immediate match demands.

The plan is for him to complete full sessions consistently, increase intensity step by step, and reconnect with the feeling of being a competitive footballer.

For Gavi, the past months have been difficult and now, feeling useful to the team again before the end of the season is his short-term objective.

Meanwhile, Luis de la Fuente has maintained regular contact with him.

The Spain coach is closely following his progress and understands both the risks and the potential reward.

De la Fuente has never hidden his admiration for the Barcelona midfielder and believes he could still play a role if he reaches the required level in time.

Reaching the World Cup will not be easy, as competition in Spain‚Äôs midfield is fierce. Despite that, if Gavi regains his rhythm and intensity, the door will not be closed.

title: Colts' Ballard ranks near bottom in free agent spending since 2020
description: Where do the Indianapolis Colts rank in free agent spending since the 2020 NFL season?
fullText:
Since 2020, the Indianapolis Colts have been one of the least active teams in NFL free agency.

Jason Fitzgerald of Over the Cap recently ranked each team by how much they've spent in free agency between 2020 and 2025 and how many free agents they've signed.

A few caveats to note as Fitzgerald put together this list were that only free agent signings in the months of March and April counted, and the deal had to be for at least $2 million. This data also only included new additions and not any re-signings.

During that span, the Colts' 15 free agent additions that qualify for this list are tied for the sixth-fewest in the NFL. Indianapolis is also the eighth-lowest spender in average free agent dollars each offseason at $125.98 million.

However, when GM Chris Ballard has made signings, he has spent big, with the Colts average contract per player ranking near the top of the league at $8.39 million.

Overall, the Colts are ranked 27th in Fitzgerald's rankings.

"We like our guys," is a familiar phrase that Ballard has said over the years, which is, in part, why the Colts rank near the bottom of this free agency spending list.

Last offseason, however, we saw a more aggressive approach. This included signing Daniel Jones and spending fairly big on Charvarius Ward and Cam Bynum.

Ballard seemingly acknowledged¬†that continuing down that path was going to be the plan this offseason.

The Colts are positioned relatively well from a salary cap standpoint to do so as well.

This article originally appeared on Colts Wire: NFL free agency: Where do Colts rank in free agent spending since 2020?

title: Donald Trump fixes Uros Medic‚Äôs immigration issues after KOTY win at UFC Houston
description: UFC fighters with visa problems just learned something in Houston over the weekend: ask and ye shall receive. Uros Medic won his co-main fight against Geoff Neal via violent first round knockout (watch it here) and then followed that up not with a request ‚Äî not for a $100,000 bonus (which he got anyway) but [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
UFC fighters with visa problems just learned something in Houston over the weekend: ask and ye shall receive.

Uros Medic won his co-main fight against Geoff Neal via violent first round knockout (watch it here) and then followed that up not with a request ‚Äî not for a $100,000 bonus (which he got anyway) but for help with his immigration issues.

‚ÄúNow I got one little problem,‚Äù Medic declared in the cage. ‚ÄúImmigration‚Äôs been holding me up and I can‚Äôt travel just yet. So this is my plea for help. President, Mr. President, if you can see this, please, we gotta go to Belgrade, Serbia for the UFC this summer.‚Äù

We have our doubts the UFC will make the trip to Serbia any time soon, but Medic now can because UFC CEO Dana White got U.S. president Donald Trump on the phone to take care of his issues.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm back in his office and Dana‚Äôs got president Donald Trump on speaker phone,‚Äù Medic said at the post-fight press conference. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just standing there and I cannot believe what‚Äôs happening. I‚Äôm talking to the president, and he said, ‚ÄòYou‚Äôre good to go wherever you please. You can travel. Just give Dana documentation, the information that you need.'‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm just blown away. I mean, I love Mr. President, and his wife is from Slovenia, First Lady Melania ‚Ä¶ It was just amazing for me to be able to tell him about the situation and how big of a fan I am of him. And obviously, his wife, who is from where I‚Äôm from ‚Äì or I‚Äôm considering where I‚Äôm from, even though it‚Äôs a different country. It‚Äôs like a five-hour drive. That‚Äôs nothing for America. Like, you can‚Äôt even get out of Texas in five hours.‚Äù

‚ÄúSo yeah, I‚Äôm still processing all of it.‚Äù

That‚Äôs great news for Medic, who has been unable to travel back to his home country for three years now. Between the knockout of the year candidate, his $100,000 bonus, and getting his visa fixed, it‚Äôs been a pretty good weekend for the Serbian fighter.

title: Goal Contribution King ‚Äì Italy Wingback Most Industrious Inter Milan Player Under Cristian Chivu

fullText:
Inter Milan wingback Federico Dimarco has emerged as the club‚Äôs leading goal contributor under Cristian Chivu this season.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì JANUARY 23: Federico Dimarco of FC Internazionale Milano scores his team‚Äôs fourth goal during the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and Pisa SC at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on January 23, 2026 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

Moreover, the Italian star has netted five league goals, adding one 

As such, he has been indispensable to Inter Milan‚Äôs attacking output this season.

title: üö® Four months before kick-off: World Cup manager steps down
description: With Cura√ßao, he achieved the sensation: the island nation will participate in the Football World Cup this summer. However, not with Dick Advocaat on the sidelines. The Dutchman has decided to step d...
fullText:
With Cura√ßao, he achieved the sensation: the island nation will participate in the Football World Cup this summer. However, not with Dick Advocaat on the sidelines. The Dutchman has decided to step down for personal reasons.

The association confirmed this on 'X'. His successor has already been determined: Fred Rutten will lead the team at the tournament in America, Mexico, and Canada.

The coach himself also speaks out and comments on his reasons. "I have always said that family comes before football for me," said Advocaat.

However, this does not change the fact that he will miss Cura√ßao, the people there, and his colleagues very much. "The qualification of the smallest FIFA country in the world for the World Cup is one of the highlights of my career. I am proud of my players and my coaching staff, as well as the board members who believed in us," explained the 78-year-old.

This article was translated into English by Artificial Intelligence. You can read the original version in üá©üá™ here.

title: Burrows looks to past form to rediscover mojo
description: Left-back Harrison Burrows feels he is getting back to his best for Sheffield United after a sticky patch at Bramall Lane.
fullText:
Sheffield United's Harrison Burrows says he is getting back to his best after a sticky patch at Bramall Lane.

The 24-year-old, who enjoyed a fine first season with the Blades last year after joining from Peterborough United, lost his starting place at the beginning of October after a dip in confidence.

But, restored to the left-back spot by Chris Wilder and buoyed by his goal against Sheffield Wednesday on Sunday, Burrows believes he is nearing top form again.

"I've not been in the best form of my career so it has been about conversations and just reminding myself of the player that I am and getting back to the level that I know I can get to," he told BBC Radio Sheffield.

"Reminding myself in my own head of what a player I was last year and what I can achieve and what I want the end of my career to look like... That's the motivation to me."

Burrows' goal - his second of the season - helped United to a 2-1 derby win which leaves them 14th and six points outside the play-off positions ahead of Wednesday's meeting with Championship leaders Coventry at Bramall Lane (19:45 GMT).

"Our goal is to get into the play-offs and we're going to keep working as hard as we can and strive for it," added Burrows.

title: Real Madrid continue pursuit of El Aynaoui
description: Real Madrid continues to monitor Roma‚Äôs Moroccan midfielder El Aynaoui with interest. According to Radio Man√† Man√†, the player is in the sights of Los Blancos, who intend to strengthen their midfi...
fullText:
Real Madrid continues to monitor Roma‚Äôs Moroccan midfielder El Aynaoui with interest.

According to Radio Man√† Man√†, the player is in the sights of Los Blancos, who intend to strengthen their midfield next season.

El Aynaoui‚Äôs performances with Morocco in the recent Africa Cup of Nations, a tournament in which his national team reached the final, losing in extra time to Man√©‚Äôs Senegal, particularly piqued the Spanish club‚Äôs interest.

Despite interest from top European clubs like Real Madrid, Roma has yet to set a price for the player, who currently remains an integral part of the Giallorossi squad.

The club‚Äôs management has no intention of selling him, at least for now. There have been no official contacts between the Madrid club and Roma yet, but the situation will be closely monitored as the summer transfer window approaches.

Negotiations could come to a head in June if Real Madrid decides to intensify their efforts to sign the Moroccan midfielder, formerly of Lens.

title: Connor Zilisch shares karting story that proved Kimi Antonelli was destined for F1
description: Connor Zilisch says he always knew Kimi Antonelli was destined for Formula 1 after racing him in karting
fullText:
19-year-old NASCAR Cup driver Connor Zilisch said he could always tell that Kimi Antonelli would get into Formula 1 after karting together.

The two grew up karting together when the American driver would spend his summers in Europe to gain experience other forms of racing. During an appearance on the Gypsy Tales podcast, the Trackhouse Racing driver explained that Antonelli was "one of the best drivers" he had raced against.

"I spent a lot of time in Europe. Those were some of the coolest moments of my life. I went to Europe as an 11, 12, 13, 14-year-old. I spent a couple of summers over there when I was not in school. I would go over there for three months at a time, racing against guys like Kimi Antonelli.

"I spent three or four years racing against him. I always knew he was going to make it to F1. I always knew. He's one of the best drivers, top three drivers I've ever raced against, just talent-wise. So I always knew he was one of the guys that was going to make it and then guys like Arvid Lindblad, he's going to race for VCARB.

"It's crazy to see that they've gone on to race in F1 and that kind of thing. But karting is such a cool sport. I didn't realise it at the time, but those days and months that I spent in Europe, without my parents, growing up, I would ride my bike to dinner alone. Those were the coolest days of my life, and I didn't realise it at the time, how cool it was.

"The memories that I have of it, looking back at it, I grew up and learned so much as a kid and matured. I definitely look back on those days as some of the coolest days I'll ever have."

Asked to elaborate on what he saw in Antonelli, who is about to enter his second F1 season with Mercedes, Zilisch added: "He's the guy that no matter what his set-up is, no matter what the track is, no matter what the conditions are, there's guys who just always persevere and are always at the front.

"And he was one of those guys that no matter what the situation was, if it was practice or if it was a heat race or, whatever it was, he was always at the front. He could just maximise his kart.

"And it's funny, I have a story. He came to race in America. He did a race at Miami, and one of my best friends was team-mates with him, and him and his dad thought that it was all his motor. And so he was team-mates with Kimi, and Kimi switched engines with him because the kid was like 'Man it's got to be his engine.'

"So Kimi literally switched motors with this kid. Kimi went faster and he slowed down, and that was just one of the things where it's a situation of you don't realise how much of a difference he's actually making until you do something like that.

"You just assume that it's the equipment and for him to be like, 'OK, let's switch then.' And they switch, and Kimi goes faster. That's something that I've always pointed to when I've thought about Kimi. He makes the most of everything he gets in."

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: Michael Carrick shares honest thoughts on Marcus Rashford leaving Man Utd for Barcelona
description: Michael Carrick addressed Marcus Rashford‚Äôs absence from the Manchester United first-team after the England star signed for Barcelona last summer. The 44-year-old, now back in a coaching role at United, had played alongside Rashford during the later years of his own career at Old Trafford.
fullText:
Michael Carrick addressed Marcus Rashford‚Äôs absence from the Manchester United first-team after the England star signed for Barcelona last summer.

The 44-year-old, now back in a coaching role at United, had played alongside Rashford during the later years of his own career at Old Trafford.

Carrick also worked with the 28-year-old England international during his coaching stints under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and Jose Mourinho.

While Rashford was part of Carrick‚Äôs squad during his caretaker spell in 2021, that has not been the case since he returned as interim manager this season.

The British forward left the club in 2025 and has spent this season on loan at Barcelona.

Rashford fell out of favour under Ruben Amorim during the 2024-25 season and spent the second half of the campaign on loan at Aston Villa.

Aston Villa chose not to make his move permanent, so Rashford returned briefly to Old Trafford during Amorim‚Äôs time in charge.

But it was Barcelona who offered him a fresh start, making the decision to sign him from United during last summer‚Äôs transfer window.

At his pre-match press conference, Carrick was asked whether he felt it was unfortunate that Rashford had left United, given their history as teammates and coach-player.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs difficult to say, you know, because circumstances at certain times, that I haven‚Äôt been involved in,‚Äù the Englishman said, according to Manchester United‚Äôs official website.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs difficult for me to comment, really. I think the fact he‚Äôs come through the academy and had such a big impact here is a positive and as a club, he‚Äôs had some really big moments, and good moments, and I‚Äôve shared some with him in the past, you know?‚Äù

The former Manchester United forward has found new life away from Old Trafford and has been playing well under Hansi Flick at the Camp Nou during the 2025-26 season.

Carrick pointed to Rashford‚Äôs career path as a good example of how unpredictable football can be these days.

‚ÄúSo, football throws up certain things and obviously certain players, you can‚Äôt stay here forever and things happen.

This season, Rashford has made 34 appearances for Barcelona in all competitions, scoring 10 goals and providing 13 assists so far.

title: Inter Academy New England: a complete immersion into the Inter world
description: It was an exciting week made up of unforgettable moments for the girls at Inter Academy New England, who took part in a fully immersive journey into the Nerazzurri world. Through visits to the stadium...
fullText:
It was an exciting week made up of unforgettable moments for the girls at Inter Academy New England, who took part in a fully immersive journey into the Nerazzurri world.

Through visits to the stadium, training ground, and the Club's headquarters, the American delegation had the opportunity to experience the passion, history, and values that define Inter.

On the night of Inter vs. Juventus, which ended with the Nerazzurri winning 3-2, the young Academy players experienced firsthand the intensity of one of the most legendary rivalries in Italian football.

Before kick-off, the girls took part in activities and fan interactions in the Museo LED area, taking photos and creating content for social platforms, which added to the atmosphere. They then took to the stage of the Inter Live Show in a night made even more memorable by the Nerazzurri's victory.

To close out the stadium experience, the Academy had the chance to watch the squad's warm-up up close, soaking in the moments leading up to kick-off from a unique perspective in a crucial match.

The journey continued at the Konami Football Centre, where the girls participated in training sessions throughout the week, led by the technical staff of the Nerazzurri Youth Sector. It was an incredible and educational experience that allowed the young participants to interact directly with the Club's ideology.

On Friday, two players from the Inter Women's squad and coach Gianpiero Piovani came onto the pitch and made the week even more memorable. Through moments of connection and the presentation of final participation certificates by Bugeja, Bowen, and the coach, the girls at the Academy felt a sense of belonging to the Nerazzurri family.

The visit came to an end at Inter HQ, with an exclusive Trophy Room Tour. It served as a journey into the Club's history through trophies and achievements that tell the story of the Nerazzurri's glories and inspire future generations.

It was a week that will stay in the hearts of the young Inter Academy New England players, highlighting the strength of the Inter Academy project globally. It is a connection across cultures, brought together by the same colours and Nerazzurri passion.

fullText:
He had created a sensation with Cura√ßao: the island state will participate in the World Cup this summer. But it won't be with Dick Advocaat on the bench. The Dutchman has decided to resign for personal reasons.

I am proud of my players and my coaching team, as well as the board members who believed in us," said the 78-year-old.

fullText:
Former England striker Gary Lineker has just compared Chelsea‚Äôs Joao Pedro with Arsenal striker Kai Havertz.

Lineker has been reviewing the latest round of Premier League games on his Podcast this morning, and he has looked at what he believes to be some clear comparisons with Pedro and former Blues man, Kai Havertz.

I am sure this is going to split opinions and also, many Chelsea fans will be left wondering whether it‚Äôs a good or a bad thing that one of our strikers is being compared with Havertz, because many Blues fans never even rated him when he was here!

Joao Pedro looks on against Burnley. (Photo by Jasper Wax/Getty Images)

‚ÄòI think¬†he‚Äôs¬†a very good¬†footballer,¬†he‚Äôs¬†technically very gifted. I think¬†he‚Äôs¬†a really¬†good player, he does remind me a little bit of Kai Havertz.

‚ÄòThey‚Äôre¬†similar type of players, both very technically gifted and they both almost glide around the pitch. I think¬†he‚Äôs¬†a really¬†good player.‚Äô

title: Manuel Neuer back in individual training ahead of Bayern vs. Dortmund clash
description: Manuel Neuer has returned to individual training ahead of Bayern Munich‚Äôs Bundesliga top-of-the-table clash with Borussia Dortmund on Saturday.After missing Bayern‚Äôs 3-2 win over Eintracht Frankfu...
fullText:
Manuel Neuer has returned to individual training ahead of Bayern Munich‚Äôs Bundesliga top-of-the-table clash with Borussia Dortmund on Saturday.

After missing Bayern‚Äôs 3-2 win over Eintracht Frankfurt on Saturday due to a calf muscle fiber injury, the 39-year-old completed a 30-minute session on Monday, according to Bild.

The session included goalkeeper exercises, though Neuer worked mostly on the ground and did not perform any jumps or high-intensity movements.

It remains uncertain whether Neuer will be fit for Saturday or if Jonas Uebig will start in goal once again.

Speaking after the win over Eintracht, Bayern board member for sport Max Eberl did not completely rule out a return for Neuer this weekend.

title: Former Bayern Munich star announces shock exit due to mental health
description: All the struggles finally took their toll
fullText:
Philippe Coutinho was once among the most talented stars in European football. From a treble-winning loan spell at Bayern Munich in 2019/20 after some dazzling nights at Liverpool to a ‚Ç¨135 million move to Barcelona, the Brazilian‚Äôs career seemed unstoppable at its peak. Now, it has reached an unexpected and sobering turn.

Per a report from Tz, Coutinho has announced the termination of his contract with Vasco da Gama, his boyhood club in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The decision, confirmed via his social channels, came despite talks of a possible extension. Instead, the 33-year-old requested for a premature termination, one that the club granted.

The reason is deeply personal. Coutinho admitted he is ‚Äúmentally exhausted.‚Äù Years of serious knee injuries have taken their toll, both physically and emotionally. Growing criticism from fans, including jeering during a recent cup match, only added to the weight.

In an emotional farewell, he described stepping away with a heavy heart, insisting his connection to Vasco remains strong. Whether this signals the end of his career or simply a pause remains unclear.

title: Report ‚Äì Roma Wingback Set For Summer Farewell Amid Inter Milan Interest

fullText:
Roma wingback Zeki Celik is reportedly on the verge of leaving the club amid growing interest from Inter Milan.

According to Corriere dello Sport via FCInterNews, the 29-year-old‚Äôs future lies away from Rome.

Celik‚Äôs contract at the Stadio Olimpico runs out in June, with Roma reluctant to offer him fresh terms.

Despite his contractual wobble, the Turkish star remains an indispensable starter under Gian Piero Gasperini.

Indeed, he has made 23 appearances in Serie A this season.

SASSUOLO, ITALY ‚Äì OCTOBER 26: Zeki √áelik of AS Roma in action during the Serie A match between US Sassuolo Calcio and AS Roma at Mapei Stadium Citta del Tricolore on October 26, 2025 in Sassuolo, Italy. (Photo by Alessandro Sabattini/Getty Images)

Negotiations over Celik‚Äôs contract renewal have hit a standstill.

Indeed, his agent is reportedly asking for a substantial pay rise, demanding around ‚Ç¨4 million net per season.

Meanwhile, the Giallorossi have no intention of matching Celik‚Äôs request.

Therefore, a summer exit is looming, with Inter keeping close tabs on the former Lille ace.

Zeki Celik would be a decent coup for the Nerazzurri, especially considering they wouldn‚Äôt have to pay a dime to secure his signature.

title: ‚ÄòTime to pull our sleeves up‚Äô: India coach Ryan ten Doeschate hints at playing XI shake-up after Super 8 defeat
description: Following a heavy defeat to South Africa in Super 8s, India's batting unit faces scrutiny, with assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate confirming that changes, including the potential inclusion of Sanju Samson, are being considered. The team's left-hand heavy top order has struggled, prompting a rethink of their strategy for upcoming crucial matches.
fullText:
Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. 

India‚Äôs left-hand heavy top order once again crumbled under pressure during the chase of 188, eventually collapsing to 111. The spotlight fell heavily on out-of-form opener Abhishek Sharma, who managed just 15 ‚Äî his first runs of the tournament after three consecutive ducks ‚Äî and Tilak Varma, whose struggles have compounded India‚Äôs fragile starts.

Addressing the selection dilemma, ten Doeschate acknowledged that bringing in a right-hand option like Samson is under serious consideration.

‚ÄúYeah, of course, we have looked at the five outings we have had now, four teams have opened with part-time off spin, and it has got a wicket every time, apart from the USA game where we lost Abhi without score in any case (to pacer Ali Khan),‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúSo to start every inning zero for one, I think it has literally been zero or a couple of runs for one every time is obviously putting pressure on the link players. Tilak and SKY (Surya), their role is to link up with the guys at the back end, and it has not gone that way,‚Äù he added.

128703198Advertisement
India now face a tough call between backing struggling players and making bold changes.

‚ÄúYou stick with the guys who we feel have performed really well over the last 18 months and who are maybe shy of a few runs now? Or do we twist and bring Sanju, who is also a fantastic player and obviously helps tactically with having a right-hander at the top of the order, and I am sure that will be a talking point over the next few days, going into these two very important games,‚Äù he said.

Ten Doeschate also revealed that Abhishek‚Äôs poor run has been compounded by illness.

‚ÄúYou want him to be up and running and sort of confident in his swing and confident in his game plan (on Abhishek), and when you score three zeroes, that is going to start weighing on you. I saw some really good signs on Friday night in the nets. I think I mentioned it in the presser then. But he looks a little bit short, and our job as the coaching staff is to pull that right. We have got four days to do that,‚Äù he added.

He also defended Rinku Singh, whose returns as finisher have been modest.

‚ÄúThere is no point talking about rhythm in nets or how guys are feeling or what they are not feeling. It is time to pull our sleeves up and get performance out of all the players, and like I just said there, that is the challenge for the staff, along with the players now, to regroup and put in a big effort leading up to the next game against Zimbabwe,‚Äù he concluded.

title: Sinners & Saints: Roma 3, Cremonese 0
description: At the risk of beating a dead horse, Roma fans have grown wary of matches like yesterday‚Äôs victory over Cremonese, fixtures where outside results have fallen in the club‚Äôs favor, giving the Giallorossi an opportunity to climb the table. In this instance, with 5th-place Juventus and 3rd-place Napoli each suffering defeats earlier in the weekend, [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
At the risk of beating a dead horse, Roma fans have grown wary of matches like yesterday‚Äôs victory over Cremonese, fixtures where outside results have fallen in the club‚Äôs favor, giving the Giallorossi an opportunity to climb the table. In this instance, with 5th-place Juventus and 3rd-place Napoli each suffering defeats earlier in the weekend, Roma not only had the chance to pad their lead over Juve but could wake up Monday in third place, four points ahead of Juventus, ahead of their clash at the Olimpico next weekend.

Fortunately, unlike so many disappointing weekends before, Roma prevailed over lowly Cremonese, overcoming a slow first half to win 3-0 in front of 60,000 of their closest friends. Given the ease with which they won and the lack of any glaring errors, today‚Äôs Sinners & Saints will skew entirely toward the positive!

Always the goat, seldom the hero, Cristante delivered arguably his best performance of the season. Starting alongside Manu Kon√© and Lorenzo Pellegrini in midfield, Cristante overcame his presumed sadness over Canada‚Äôs loss in the Gold Medal game with a dynamic 90-minute run against Cremonese: three key passes, 15 passes into the final third, five tackles, four recoveries, one assist, and, of course, the match-winning goal, a perfectly executed header at the near post off a Pellegrini corner.

Cristante will always have his detractors, but at least for one night, he was unquestionably the best player on the pitch.

Not far behind Cristante in the post-match pecking order, Ndicka brought his usual class to the backline, limiting Cremonese to a pitiful two shots on goal while adding five clearances and three ball recoveries to his defensive ledger. While we‚Äôve come to expect those defensive performances from Ndicka, the Ivorian international was surprisingly busy in attack, firing four shots on goal, including a crucial 77th-minute goal, his first league goal of the season.

If we shine light on Ndicka for smothering Cremonese‚Äôs attack, it‚Äôs only right to share the spotlight with Mancini. Not only did Roma‚Äôs masked man lead the club with eight defensive actions and play seven balls into the final third, but he also managed to avoid a yellow card! With nine of those bad boys already in his back pocket heading into this match, any transgression on Sunday would have meant Mancini would miss next week‚Äôs six-pointer against Juventus.

I‚Äôm sure this will be a semi-controversial selection, but while Pellegrini didn‚Äôt necessarily turn in a standout performance, he served up the match-winning assist thanks to a well-placed corner kick that met Cristante‚Äôs head just as he started to peel away from the near post. Sure, Roma would tack on two additional goals, but let‚Äôs appreciate the context of this assist: it was preceded by 59 mostly frustrating misses in which Roma reeled off a dozen shots with nothing to show for it.

All told, Pellegrini created three chances while completing two of three long balls.

The other Lorenzo didn‚Äôt factor in the box score, but the young midfielder wasted little time terrorizing the Cremonese backline. In only 34 minutes, Venturino created three scoring chances and hit on 11 of 12 passes. It may not have been a wow performance, but it did provide a glimpse into the future: Venturino already looks like the ideal pesky, creative winger that any attacking side craves, especially one as fluid as Gasperini‚Äôs.

The only negative thing we can say about Kon√© is this: he doesn‚Äôt have a nose for goal. If he ever develops a better long-range shot and can convert those late runs into the box, he‚Äôll probably be bound for PSG, so we‚Äôll count our blessings for now. Outside of skying a few attempts high and wide, Kon√© completed 89% of his passes, created two scoring chances, and recovered six balls.

Relegated to the bench with Kon√©‚Äôs return to the lineup, the local kid still managed to make his mark against Cremonese, breaking the visitors back with an 86th-minute goal. In his 18-minute cameo, the young Roman recovered to balls, played three passes into the final third and managed two shots on goal.

title: 3 Detroit Lions make PFF‚Äôs top-10 players of 2025 ranking
description: Not only did the Detroit Lions lead the NFC North in PFF‚Äôs top-101 players of 2025 list, but they also had 3 in the top-10.
fullText:
The 2025 Detroit Lions season may not have gone as the team wanted, but it only reaffirmed their star power, according to analytics site PFF. Late last week, PFF revealed their top-101 players from the 2025 season, and the Lions had five players make the list, all within the top-50. More impressively, though, they had three players make PFF‚Äôs top-10 players of the 2025 season.

First up on the list was Jahmyr Gibbs, who came in at 47 on the list. Gibbs, who finished fifth in the NFL in yards from scrimmage last year, was sixth in PFF grade among all running backs last year.

Receiver Amon-Ra St. Brown was next on the list, barely missing the top-10 by placing 17th overall. Fourth in receiving yards in 2025, St. Brown produced a PFF receiving grade of 90+ for his fourth consecutive season.

The three top-10 Lions players were as follows:

Campbell was PFF‚Äôs highest-graded linebacker of 2025, and he‚Äôs got the first-team All Pro to go with it. He led the NFL in PFF‚Äôs ‚Äúdefensive stops,‚Äù recording four more than any other defensive player in football.

Hutchinson led the NFL in pressure, both according to PFF and NFL Pro. In addition to that, PFF credits him with a 23.1% pass rush win rate, trailing only two other players (Myles Garrett and Will Anderson Jr.).

Sewell, despite getting snubbed for Protector of the Year at the NFL Honors in February, was PFF‚Äôs highest-graded offensive lineman in 2025. In their rankings, PFF noted that his 98.7 overall grade in the Lions‚Äô Week 3 win over the Ravens was the highest score ever recorded for an offensive tackle in the PFF era.

Only the Rams had more than one player in the top-10 (Puka Nacua, Matthew Stafford).

As for the rest of the NFC North, here‚Äôs how many players each team had in the top-101:

Bears: 3 (Darnell Wright, Colston Loveland, Joe Thuney)

Packers: 3 (Jordan Love, Micah Parsons, Xavier McKinney)

Check out the entire PFF top-101 players of 2025 rankings here.
